SupportItemCategory: Assistive products for household tasks and access
Description: Ramp to transition between levels, usually into a dwelling or vehicle. Removable and transportable without equipment.

SupportItemCategory: Assistive products for household tasks and access
SupportItem: Home Safety - Slip Resistance Coating / Grab and/or Guide Rails
Description: Grab/guide rails, surface treatments, and other lower cost home adaptations for participant access and safety

SupportItemCategory: Beds and pressure care mattresses and accessories
Description: Complete pressure reduction mattress or overlay specifically to manage tissue integrity when reclined

SupportItemCategory: Beds and pressure care mattresses and accessories
SupportItem: Pressure Reduction Mattress or Overlay - High Complexity Need
Description: Variable and active pressure management mattress or overlay for high risk tissue integrity needs

SupportItemCategory: Beds and pressure care mattresses and accessories
SupportItem: Bed - Access / Transfer Pole / Blocks / Rails / Rail-Covers
Description: Devices for self-assisted transfer/position in bed; rails and rail covers which attach to a bed to prevent the individual falling out.

SupportItemCategory: Beds and pressure care mattresses and accessories
Description: Tables, supports and other devices for holding items for activity for a lying person (Over-Bed Table or Support).

SupportItemCategory: Beds and pressure care mattresses and accessories
SupportItem: Bed - Accessories and Sleep Positioning System - Custom made
Description: Positioning supports and surfaces to help an individual maintain a consistent and optimal position while lying in bed.

SupportItemCategory: Beds and pressure care mattresses and accessories
Description: A bed which can be adjusted in height or angle through an electronic mechanism (may include companion bed); includes adjustable High/Low Bed/Cot Frames with Repositioning Systems.

SupportItemCategory: Beds and pressure care mattresses and accessories
Description: A bed to address a participant's functional needs that has manual or no adjustment (Bed Frame / Cot / Cradle).

SupportItemCategory: Equipment or aids for dressing or specialised clothing
Description: Vest used for people with thermoregulatory problems
Chairs with an in built mechanical or electric system to assist the individual in movement to a standing position.

SupportItem: Specialised Seating - Static with Pressure Management and/or Postural Support
Description: Custom fit seating (including lounge furniture) for an individual with body shape or complex pressure care needs to accommodate (complex postural/tissue care needs).

SupportItem: Specialised Lounge Chair - Mobile with Pressure Management /Positioning Systems
Description: Lounge type chair with wheels that has features to manage tissue integrity and/or help with occupation posture control
Apparatus to hold an individual in a standing position (5 years old to teenager)

SupportItem: Standing Frame / Support for Standing - Adult
Description: Apparatus to hold an individual in a standing position (adult)

SupportItem: Standing / Walking Frame - Powered Component (including Myoelectric)
Description: Powered or electronically controlled feature, including FES functions added to a standing or walking frame (to be used with a standing/walking frame code)
Repairs to any toileting or bathing equipment
Postural support inserted into a bath or placed on a stand, for a person who requires assistance to sit / transfer safely during bathing.
Fixed or height adjustable change table or mobile trolley
Power adjustable change table or shower trolley, for child or adult.
Wheeled shower/commode chair for use in the shower or toileting
Custom-made wheeled shower / commode chair for use in the shower or toileting

SupportItem: Shower Commode - Wheeled - Tilt in Space
Description: Shower / commode chair for use in the shower or toileting that can tilt the seated participant to maintain posture (particularly for those with low tone)
A chair for use over the toilet or in the shower that may include a pan holder beneath. Often low cost AT.
Raised or special seats, bidet and other toilet attachments used to address functional limitations in toileting

SupportItem: Safety Devices - Adapted Smoke Detector / Doorbells
Description: Amplified visual alert and/or vibratory alarms

SupportItem: Adapted Devices for Phone Access / Alarms / Clocks / Programmable Memory Devices
Description: Adaption to reliably operate / use a mainstream product where possible. Device adaption required because of the person's disability need.

SupportItem: Safety Device - Flashing or Vibrating Doorbell / Smoke Alert / Personal Alarms
Description: Visual alert or vibrating smoke alarm packages for participants with hearing disability

SupportItem: Seizure Mat / Location Alert Type Alarm Systems
Description: Alert system for detecting a seizure (e.g., epileptic) or identifying when a person with cognitive impairment goes beyond a safe zone.
Non-invasive device to assist a person with weakened breathing or cough ability to clear secretions.
Accessory that filters and treats (humidifies/heats) air particularly when ventilation is through a hole in the air pipe (tracheostomy).

SupportItem: Repairs and Maintenance - Disability-related Health Machines
Description: Repairs And Maintenance - Health-Related Technology (Only For NDIS-Funded Items)

SupportItem: Cyclic Pressure Unit - Replacement Garments and Compression Sleeves
Description: Replacement garment or sleeve for surrounding an affected part of the body, for use with a compression pump to aid the circulation and prevent swelling.

SupportItem: Ventilator - Invasive Ventilation for Continuous Use
Description: Device for artificial ventilation through an artificial hole in the air pipe (tracheostomy) for a person who is unable to breathe independently. Includes ventilators that filter or purify the surrounding air.

SupportItem: Ventilator - Supplemental Ventilation Support (including CPAP and BPAP)
Description: Devices for providing artificial ventilation through the nose, the mouth or an artificial hole in the air pipe (tracheostomy) for a person who has difficulties with breathing. Included are, e.g., Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP), Bilevel Positive Airway Pressure (BPAP).
Devices to amplify one or more person's voice (primarily for group / meeting settings where individuals have hearing / voice impairment).

SupportItem: Communication and Information AT - Computer / Device interfaces
Description: Includes keyboards, trackballs, text to speech and other peripherals and tools (Reading / Writing / Input / Output Items)

SupportItem: Communication AT - Face to Face Electronic Devices
Description: Electronic communication devices with customisable and changing screens, to allow highly customised voice output generation and may include multiple input methods (Speech Generating Devices / Visual Technology / Communication Devices).

SupportItem: Communication AT - Non-Electronic Devices / Books / Tools for Face to Face
Description: Communication boards accessed by pointing, eye gaze or other selection methods - usually non-electronic (Communication Devices, Books and tools)

SupportItem: Personal Reader - Speech and Visual Output
Description: Electronic device, primarily for people with visual or reading disability.
Electronic device which converts text to speech.

SupportItem: Vision - Portable Audible Player for Read Content
Description: Portable audible player for connection to computers
Programming and/or customising electronic equipment (e.g. communication devices) to meet the individual's disability-specific needs.

SupportItem: Communication AT - Software related items for Computer / Tablet / Phone - Advanced
Description: Software to convert a tablet or computer device to a communication device.

SupportItem: Communication / ICT AT - Complex need interface - Eye or EMG / Neural Control
Description: Hardware and software that directs or selects inputs by visual gaze or neural/neuromuscular action to activate a computer or face to face communication device.

SupportItem: Communication AT - Simple Button or Keys with Voice Output
Description: A device which provides an audible message when triggered.
Portable personal device to amplify voice where there is a vocal impairment.

SupportItem: Computer Tablet or Smartphone with critical Sensory or Cognitive Apps
Description: Required for participation in home and community, not solely for education or work. e.g. visual navigation. See ÒWould We Fund ItÓ guide on NDIS website.

An electronic instrument that provides amplification to individuals with a hearing loss (OSPL90 >= 128 dBSPL) IEC RTF 1600 Hz. Includes 10+ channels, feedback management, adaptive noise control, option to add telecoil, directional microphone, and minimum bandwidth of 8kHz.
This support requires written assessment from a suitably qualified practitioner prior to supply.

An electronic instrument that provides amplification to individuals with a hearing loss and provides increased functions over and above what can be met with standard level devices. May include speech enhancement, sound management, ear to ear technology, and volume controls.
This support requires written assessment from a suitably qualified practitioner prior to supply.

An electronic instrument that provides amplification to individuals with a hearing loss and provides increased functions over and above what can be met with intermediate level devices. May include one or more of the following features; 24+ channels, tinnitus reduction, smartphone connectivity, automatic programming, wireless, compatibility with accessories, remote programming.
This support requires written assessment from a suitably qualified audiologist prior to supply.
A device that offers specific technology to meet a particular functional requirement, which cannot be met by a Standard, Intermediate or Advanced hearing device. Audiologist assessment required.

SupportItem: Hearing device - External Speech Processor and Accessories
Description: Replacement external speech processor and accessories, including programming, for implanted hearing devices - both bone anchored and within the inner ear
Adapted Landline Telephones with features including amplified sound, different ring pitch and visual alerts using wireless Bluetooth with a landline.
Visual or vibrating alert for those hard of hearing
Designed for individual use in private and public situations including reception counters, meetings and other appointments.
Portable couplers that allow individuals with hearing aids to access music via audio devices.

SupportItem: Hearing device - Personal Amplifiers / Binaural Listener
Description: Personal sound amplifiers can be worn, systems usually consist of a small box with a microphone to pick up sound which is then amplified and sent to the ears via headphones or earbuds.

A remote control that enables changes to be made to hearing aids without touching the hearing devices. It allows access to volume and program changes for people with poor or nil manual dexterity and for use by carers.
Separate microphone (and, where needed, interface) to capture speech from a person at a distance from the hearer (e.g. a teacher in a classroom or lecture hall)
Systems for delivering sound directly from the TV to the ear
Printer that provides hardcopy readable information from a computer (usually braille). May also translate the braille to speech.
Small and portable device that can be used to take notes in braille for later use.
A desktop device for enlarging an image of the subject that has been captured by a video camera (using Video/CCTV).
Video system which magnifies text or pictures

SupportItem: Vision - Mobile Phone with Special Functionality
Description: A mobile phone with voice output and enlarged visual display for significant vision loss
Software on a computer or tablet that provides verbal output, magnification of screen content beyond that available in OEM Operating System (LP Keyboard)
Repair costs for vision equipment.
Portable device and/or software or app that provides detailed navigation guidance for a person with vision impairment
Specially trained dog deemed reasonable and necessary in line with NDIA policy

SupportItem: Assistance dog (including Dog Guide) ongoing costs
Description: Extra ongoing costs (above those of a companion animal) for medication, annual vet checks, food, etc. for a dog that meets the NDIA policy
Mechanical equipment fixed to a wall or ceiling to lift an individual for transfer or moving position (use code in Home Modifications section if home modifications are required to install).
A standard supportive device made from different materials that supports the body of an individual and attaches to a hoist; to be used with a hoist to move an individual
A device that supports the body of an individual with complex needs or for specialised purposes and attaches to a hoist to move an individual; Custom Made or Bariatric.
Typically, fixed hoists for transfer into/out of pools or locations subject to weather or chlorine/salt exposure

SupportItem: Transfer AT - Mobile Hoist Seat or Table
Description: A portable mechanical device used to transfer an individual from a sitting position with solid seat.

SupportItem: Transfer AT - Mobile Hoist including Slings x2
Description: A portable mechanical device used for lifting an individual for transfer or moving position, including two slings
Repairs to transfer equipment, such as hoists and slings
A wheeled walker with brakes and a seat for the individual.
Walking devices to enable a child to maintain and develop stability and balance while walking - with specific functional features
A basic wheeled walker with frame
Walking devices that enable a person to maintain stability and balance while walking. Includes four wheeled walkers etc.

SupportItem: Walking Supports - Sticks Canes And Crutches
Description: Sticks, canes, or crutches to provide stability or partial weight bearing for people who walk.
Devices with wheels and supporting table or forearm support.

SupportItemCategory: Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
SupportItem: Postural Support - Seating System - Custom made
Description: Head, back, seat and arm / leg supports, custom-made for a participant with complex and often fixed postural support needs

SupportItemCategory: Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
SupportItem: Postural Support - Seating Componentry and Accessories
Description: Head, back, seat and arm / leg supports, with components individually aligned for the individual (e.g. adjustable as required, including moldable supports)

SupportItemCategory: Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
Description: Supports with attachment for back support and positioning for participants with limited trunk control in wheelchair and related seating

SupportItemCategory: Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
Description: Seat related supports with attachment to maintain good posture, avoiding tissue integrity risk in wheelchair and related seating

SupportItemCategory: Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
Description: Back rest, seat and arm / leg supports and components suitable for adjustment to provide postural seated support for the individual.

SupportItemCategory: Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
SupportItem: Postural Support - Air Floatation or Automatic Pressure Management
Description: Postural support using air floatation or automated pressure management system

SupportItemCategory: Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
SupportItem: Postural Support - Foam and/or Gel Component System
Description: Postural Support using foam and/or gel (Seat, Back and Other Supports Included)

SupportItemCategory: Specialised seating for wheelchairs and other wheeled mobility equipment
Description: A tray or anterior support designed to fit onto a wheelchair - for postural purposes or to hold for functional use
Wheeled devices on which a person sits or lays and moves by pushing on the floor with their arms or legs, or alternatively is assistant propelled

SupportItem: Wheeled Base - Height Adaptable Seating - Pediatric
Description: High / Low or other base for specialised stroller seating

SupportItem: Stroller / Pram / Buggy with Specialised Seating System
Description: Stroller, pram or buggy with specialised customisable seating system for children with high postural support needs

SupportItem: Stroller / Pram / Buggy / Push Chair with Supportive Seating
Description: Specialised accessories and support items including postural seating for prams and strollers

SupportItem: Wheelchair or Scooter - Battery or Charger
Description: Charger or battery (including repair) for powered device e.g. wheelchair charger with car adapter

SupportItem: Wheelchair Manual - Sport and Recreation Use
Description: Manual wheelchair designed for recreational and sport use.
Powered assistance (extra wheel, tug or drive system) used with manual wheelchairs that amplify or supplement pushing effort (does not include power wheelchair add-on kits)
Folding manual wheelchair, including lightweight and transit design.
Manual wheelchair with a very lightweight frame that is custom-made to individual measurements (not including seating).
Manual wheelchair usually with smaller wheels, designed to be pushed by an attendant. Often low cost AT.
Manual wheelchair that includes ability to tilt (front/back) the seated occupant to maintain postural position or for fatigue relief
Wheelchair with rigid frame made to an individual userÕs measurements (not including seating).

SupportItem: Wheelchair Accessory - Powered Alternate Operator Control System
Description: Wheelchair controls other than joystick

SupportItem: Wheelchair Accessory - Powered Adjustment for Limbs or Recline or Elevate
Description: Powered postural support components (e.g. leg supports) other than tilt-in-space or elevate
Powered wheelchair with included powered features to enable the participant to stand while still posturally secured in the chair.

SupportItem: Wheelchair Powered - Base with Tilt - All Terrain / Heavy Duty Base
Description: Powered wheelchair with the capability of being used across different terrains including rough/sandy settings (may or may not include tilt/recline - not including seating)

SupportItem: Wheelchair Powered - Base with / without Tilt - Indoor / Outdoor use
Description: Powered wheelchair for adult or child use in general settings, (with/without tilt) with factory seating
Powered wheelchair base for general use (may or may not include tilt/recline - not including seating), that is portable or foldable particularly for transport.

SupportItem: Scooter - Heavy Duty / Robust activity specific
Description: Powered 4 wheeled scooter for use by an individual of significant weight (>150kg) or in adverse settings
Powered occupant operated wheeled scooter for general use
Powered portable or foldable wheeled scooter, primarily for indoor use
Small powered scooter (with manual steering) that is foldable/portable for stowing in luggage areas while occupant travels in a vehicle seat.

SupportItem: Positioning / Mounting Systems - Technology and other devices
Description: Devices for positioning objects (including other AT devices) close to the person to enable easy reach and operation e.g. wheelchair AAC device mounts
Replacement tyres for wheelchair or scooter (see repair codes)

SupportItem: Wheelchair Accessory - Health-Related AT / Ventilator Carrier
Description: Wheelchair mounted accessories to safely secure health or ventilation support AT

SupportItem: Prosthesis Accessory - Arm and/or Hand for Sport and Leisure
Description: A hardware device or adaptions for arm and/or hand prosthetics, to enable participation in sport.

SupportItem: Orthosis - Dynamic or Lycra - Full Body
Description: Elastane-based or other orthoses for the full body (excluding head) designed to improve functioning
Elastane-based or other orthoses for the upper limbs (e.g. arms, shoulder) designed to improve functioning
Orthoses for specific impairments of the neck or cranium (includes helmets).
Orthoses that apply external pressure to immobilize, support or correct spinal deformities.
Prosthetic lower limb not otherwise classified below
Pair of shoes made for an individual who is unable to fit off the shelf or specialist shoes.
Custom made AFO used for a variety of neuropathic, orthopedic and congenital conditions.
Prefabricated (or customised) AFO used for a variety of neuropathic, orthopedic and congenital conditions.

SupportItem: Orthosis - Ankle Foot with Ankle Joints -Custom made
Description: Custom made AFO that include specific joint structure between foot and lower leg section

SupportItem: Orthosis - Bilateral Hip Knee Ankle Foot Orthosis - including RGO - Prefabricated
Description: Prefabricated reciprocating gait orthosis (RGO) used for coupling together hip joints to facilitate ambulation pattern

SupportItem: Orthosis - Bilateral Thoraco-lumbar/Lumbo-Sacral Hip Knee Ankle Foot - Custom made
Description: Custom made lower limb and spinal support linked orthosis to facilitate upright posture, and potentially walking
Prefabricated (off the shelf) orthoses to provide hip and pelvic stability

SupportItem: Orthosis - Hip Thigh Knee Ankle - Custom made
Description: Custom made orthosis to support hip, knee and ankle movement to support walking
Knee support custom made for individual need
Prefabricated knee orthosis adjustable for the individual

SupportItem: Orthosis - Knee Ankle Foot - Custom made
Description: Custom made orthoses providing variable control to stabilise movement of the knee and ankle

SupportItem: Orthosis - Thigh Knee Ankle - Custom made
Description: Custom orthosis spanning the knee, ankle and foot to stabilise the joints and assist the muscles of the leg.
Custom made orthosis for any combination of shoulder, elbow, wrist and hand to stabilise movement
Prefabricated orthosis for any combination of shoulder, elbow, wrist and hand to stabilise movement; prefabricated devices may be adjustable or ready to use

SupportItem: Orthosis - Foot - All Types or Prefabricated Orthotic Footwear
Description: Prefabricated orthotic to support the foot, improve posture and correct any imbalances (includes off the shelf orthopedic footwear)
Repairs for orthoses

SupportItem: Prosthesis - For use in Wet Environment (i.e. waterproofing)
Description: Prosthesis that incorporates specialised components or treatments to enable use in wet environments
Devices used to replace totally, or in part, the appearance and function of an absent body segment other than limbs

SupportItem: Prosthesis - Osseo-Integration Mounting -Upper or Lower - Additional Cost
Description: Extra cost to facilitate connection through titanium or similar bone implants to upper or lower residual limb, outside the standard prosthetic cost
Devices that replace part of the lower limb between the knee and hip joints after limb loss/absence
Devices that replace part of the lower limb between the knee and the ankle joint after limb loss/absence
Devices that replace part or all of the upper limb (not including finger replacement only)
Lower limb prosthetics customised or custom made for use in sport.

SupportItem: Orthosis - Trunk / Lower Body - FES or Powered - to support standing/walking
Description: Hybrid orthoses with powered joints and/or linked functional electrical stimulation (FES) to facilitate standing, walking, and/or stair climbing

SupportItem: Vehicle Modification - For Seating and/or Seat Belts
Description: Safety restraints and seat for use in vehicles that require approved modifier

SupportItem: Specialised Child Car Seats - No Vehicle Modification Required
Description: A child's specialised car seat, that does NOT require vehicle modification

SupportItem: Vehicle Modification - Adaptions for ancillary functions
Description: Adaptions to mirrors and locks of a vehicle (e.g. Lights, Locking, etc.)

SupportItem: Vehicle Modification - Adaptions for driver control
Description: Adaptions to the accelerator, brake/parking brake, and/or steering in a vehicle (e.g. Steering/Braking/ Acceleration)

SupportItem: Vehicle Modification - for Wheelchair Seated Driver
Description: Vehicle chassis and/or body modification for wheelchair seated driver access, including belts/securement and floor lowering if required
Vehicle chassis and/or body modification for wheelchair passenger access, including belts/harnesses and floor lowering if required

SupportItem: Vehicle Modification - Hoist/Ramp for Unoccupied Wheelchair Loading
Description: Vehicle mounted hoist for loading unoccupied wheelchairs, or a ramp for loading/unloading unoccupied wheelchairs

SupportItem: Vehicle Modification - Hoist for Passenger Loading (without Wheelchair)
Description: A powered sling system / hoist to assist in lifting an individual safely in and out of a vehicle.

SupportItem: Vehicle Modification - Hoist for Occupied Wheelchair Loading
Description: Electronic or mechanical hoist mounted to car to lift an individual in their wheelchair or scooter for transport.
Certification required by a transport authority to authorize registration for road use in a state or territory of Australia

SupportItem: Vehicle Accessory -Trailer for wheeled mobility device
Description: A purpose-built trailer to carry a wheelchair or scooter.
Hand-propelled, two-wheeled cycles for an individual with functional limitations.
Bicycles, tricycles adapted for specific functional needs - primarily for children
Interfaces that allow a person with disability to access recreational gaming equipment when unable to do so through conventional routes.

SupportItem: Bicycle - Adaptation for Pedals / Seat / Handle Bars
Description: Adaptions to existing bicycle or tricycle to address disability requirements of the participant.
